alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Marshall; Poweshiek; Story; Tama (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:57AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Thunderstorms With Locally Heavy Rainfall Early Today... An area of showers and thunderstorms continues to move east across the region early today. Rainfall estimates across southern Story County to southern Marshall County range from 1 to 2 inches. Some of these areas have seen rainfall rates in excess of 3 to 4 inches per hour for about 30 minutes. Early this morning, expect to see a period of heavy rainfall and low visibility during the morning commute; specifically for eastern Jasper and Marshall Counties through 530 am, much of Poweshiek County through 6 am and much of southern Tama County through 615 am. Ponding of water on area highways, streets and interstates may lead to briefly poor travel conditions as well. If out and about early this morning, please be aware of the rainfall and potential for some early morning travel impacts during the morning commute through around 630 am this morning. Drive carefully and slow down.
